event.title: includes St. Francois County and Washington County and has a population of 90,554 as of 2010

data.event: The Farmington Micropolitan Statistical Area includes St. Francois County and Washington County and has a population of 90,554 as of 2010.
Farmington was established in 1822 as Murphy's Settlement, named for William Murphy of Kentucky who first visited the site in 1798.
Farmington was established in 1822 as Murphy's Settlement, named for William Murphy of Kentucky who first visited the site in 1798.
A band of peaceful Onsaga-Osage Native Americans were slaughtered in 1801 and their lands captured by settlers in the infamous Battle of Red Grass Hill.

event.title: the battle, was a prominent display until 1951

data.event: A marker, bearing the site of the battle, was a prominent display until 1951 when it was stolen by vandals.
